algorithm

Class AbstractAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BagItPackaging, F5Steganography, ImageImageFrameExpanding, ImageInformationEmbeddingFrame, JPEGTextAdding, MetsSubmissionInformationPackage, OaiOreSubmissionInformationPackage, OpenStegoRandomLSBSteganography, PDFFileAttacher, PNGChunkAdding, QRCodeWatermarking, TarPackaging, TextInformationFrame, ZipPackaging

    public abstract class AbstractAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    All encapsulation algorithms have to extend this abstract class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  AbstractAlgorithm.AcceptAllFilter
      File filter that accepts all file types.

      abstract boolean fulfilledTechnicalCriteria(java.io.File carrier, java.util.List<java.io.File> payloadList)
      This method takes the technical constraints of carrier and payload (size, data format, number of files, etc.), and calculates the technical oLDScenarioCriteria that are the result of these constraints for this algorithm.

      • idealScenario

        public final Scenario idealScenario
        This Scenario describes the ideal scenario in which this algorithm should be used. The DistanceCalculator will compare this scenario with the user defined scenario for the decision making.

    • Method Detail

      • configureCarrierFileFilter

        abstract org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.SuffixFileFilter configureCarrierFileFilter()
        Will be called by the constructor. Override it to define the list of supported file formats for the carrier files.
        Returns:
        list of supported carrier file formats

      • configureDecapsulationFileFilter

        abstract org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.SuffixFileFilter configureDecapsulationFileFilter()
        Will be called by the constructor. Override it to define the list of file formats that could be the result of an encapsulation with this algorithm.
        Returns:
        list of supported file formats for decapsulation

      • configurePayloadFileFilter

        abstract org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.SuffixFileFilter configurePayloadFileFilter()
        Will be called by the constructor. Override it to define the list of supported file formats for the payload files.
        Returns:
        list of supported payload file formats

      • decapsulate

        public java.util.List<RestoredFile> decapsulate(java.io.File data)
        Checks if the data has the right file type to be a result of the used algorithm, and calls the algorithms implementation of the restore method.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        a list of restored files.

      • defineScenario

        abstract Scenario defineScenario()
        The constructor will call this function and initialise the classes scenario criteria with the returned criteria. Please note that the allowed values for the criteria of algorithm scenarios are 0 and 100. This is necessary for a correct distance calculation! Use the constants from this class.
        Returns:
        scenario criteria for this algorithm

      • encapsulate

        protected abstract java.io.File encapsulate(java.io.File carrier,
                       java.util.List<java.io.File> payload)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the encapsulation process for the passed carrier and payload files.
        Parameters:
        carrier - list of carrier files
        payload - list of payload files
        Returns:
        list of encapsulated output files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • encapsulateFiles

        public java.io.File encapsulateFiles(java.io.File carrier,
                            java.util.List<java.io.File> payloadList)
        Checks if carrier and payload files fulfil the technical criteria to be encapsulated with the algorithm, and calls the algorithms implementation of the encapsulate method afterwards.
        Parameters:
        carrier -
        payloadList -
        Returns:
        list of encapsulated files

      • fileTypesSupported

        protected boolean fileTypesSupported(java.io.File carrier,
                         java.util.List<java.io.File> payloadList)
        Checks if the file types of carrier and payload files are in the list of supported file types.
        Returns:
        true, if file types fulfill algorithm constraints

      • fulfilledAllTechnicalCriteria

        public boolean fulfilledAllTechnicalCriteria(java.io.File carrier,
                                    java.util.List<java.io.File> payload)
        This method is used by the EncapsulationData class to add algorithms to the list of possible usable algorithms, displayed in black instead of red at the GUI. It calls the implemented fulfilledTechnicalCriteria method of the algorithms and the file type check.
        Parameters:
        carrier -
        payload -
        Returns:
        check if files can be used for encapsulation with this algorithm

      • fulfilledTechnicalCriteria

        public abstract boolean fulfilledTechnicalCriteria(java.io.File carrier,
                                 java.util.List<java.io.File> payloadList)
        This method takes the technical constraints of carrier and payload (size, data format, number of files, etc.), and calculates the technical oLDScenarioCriteria that are the result of these constraints for this algorithm.
        Parameters:
        carrier -
        payloadList -
        Returns:
        TechnicalCriteria for a specific data set

      • restore

        protected abstract java.util.List<RestoredFile> restore(java.io.File data)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reverse the execution of this algorithm to restore the original payload, and if possible also the carrier files. Use decapsulate(File) instead of this function, if you want to start a real decapsulation process, because it will also check if the file has the correct file type.
        Parameters:
        data - the encapsulated data files
        Returns:
        decapsulated payload files, and if possible also original carrier files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns name of this algorithm

        toString in class java.lang.Object
